The 'economy of Africa' consists of the trade, industry, agriculture, and human
resources. , approximately 1.07 billion people [http://esa.un.org/unpp/ "World Population Prospects: The 2006
Revision"] United Nations (Department of Economic and Social Affairs, population
division) were living in 54 different countries. Africa is a resource-rich
continent but many African people are poor. Recent growth has been due to growth
in sales in commodities, services, and manufacturing.

Africa is the world's poorest inhabited continent, as measured by GDP per
capita. However, parts of the continent have made significant gains over the
last few years. In recent years, African countries consist of the fastest
growing economies in the world.
